short_summary: Replace existing copper feeder wiring between Powerhouse and Kiosk SK-1.
full_summary:
================================
### Electrical Repair Contract Opportunity - Mountain Institution

* *Reference:** [cb-434-71593549](#)
* *Solicitation Number:** 21833-23-0169/A
* *Publication Date:** 2024-05-31
* *Tender Closing Date:** 2024-06-17T17:00:00
* *Contract Attachment:** [Not Submited](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/39286/21833-23-0169a---invitation-to-tender.pdf)

Summary of Statement of Work
-------------------------------

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking qualified contractors to perform electrical repairs at the Mountain Institution. The requirement is to replace the current copper feeder wiring between the Powerhouse and Kiosk SK-1, due to failed insulation tests and irregular tripping of the 400A 3Ph breaker during the rainy season.

### Tasks Required

* Assess site conditions
* Prepare and submit lock out procedures, professional liability insurance and health and safety plan documents
* Submit shop drawings of new wires for approval before ordering materials
* Remove existing wiring and install new copper wiring of the same type and size
* Clean and re-us existing underground conduits
* Coordinate power shutdown and restoration
* Conduct continuity and insulation tests on new wires
* Dispose of waste materials created during installation
* Verify phase rotation and existing lugs at terminals

**Key Contract Details**

* **Trade agreement:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Competitive Procurement Strategy:** Lowest priced compliant bid
* **Duration of Contract:** 7 months from notification of contract award
* **Contracting Authority:** Katie McKeever
	+ Telephone: 236-380-2294
	+ Email: [Katie.McKeever@CSC-SCC.GC.CA](mailto:Katie.McKeever@CSC-SCC.GC.CA)

**Additional Information**

* Documents may be submitted in English or French
* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement
* Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process

Note: Please refer to the attached contract document for detailed information.  [Not submited]

have correctly written all details involved as listed above including important details to expect to found after correlating each element; else, the original alternate contract notice is improperly re
